Comunication

Class ConnectionClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • Comunication.ConnectionClient

  • public class ConnectionClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The class ConnectionClient manages the connection with the server.

    This class manages the actions of connect and disconnect through a Socket connection with the server application. It creates the new Thread dedicated to manage the connection with the server and to answer the server petitions for new actions.

    Version:
    v0.1 03/14/2014
    Author:
    Eduard de Torres

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates the new Thread that will manage the connection with the server.

        Creates a new SocketThread instance and starts it.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an input or output exception occurred.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Closes the connection with the server.

        public java.net.Socket getSocket()
        Returns the Socket used to create the connection with the server.
        Returns:
        the socket valeu that connected with the server or null if the socket is disconnected.

      • isTeamA

        public boolean isTeamA()
        Returns either if the client is configured to connect as a player of the team A or the team B.
        Returns:
        true for team A, false for team B.

      • setTeamA

        public void setTeamA(boolean team_a)
        Sets the configuration to connect as a player of the team A or the team B.
        Parameters:
        team_a - true for team A, false for team B.

      • getConnection_view

        public ConnectionView getConnection_view()
        Returns the JPanel that manages the view when the client isn't connected to the server.
        Returns:
